definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Chinese rulers have always tried to control their country's massive rivers.
sentences.chinese: 中國的執政者總是試圖駕馭這個國家的大江大河。

sentences.english: The only requirement is that the dictator have the requisite power to force the people.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的要求是執政者擁有驅迫人民的必要權力。

sentences.english: This “brain drain” has long bothered policymakers in poor countries.
sentences.chinese: 這種“人才外流”在貧窮的國家長久的困擾執政者們。

definition: bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to take turns/to work by roster
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
top priority job/matter of vital importance
